evidence.text: The City must designate the permissible campsites which complies with the Ordinance as modified by this preliminary injunction on street level maps. evidence.text: Plaintiffs in the case at bar include “Camp Integrity,” a community of campers located in San Rafael’s Mahon Creek Path, the San Rafael Homeless Union, and thirteen residents of the Mahon Creek Path.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs: Class Action

evidence.text: The preliminary injunction applies only to residents of the Mahon Creek Path encampment who have standing either as individually named plaintiffs herein or via the San Rafael Homeless Union.
evidence.source_document: Order Granting in Part and Denying in Part Plaintiffs’ Motion for Preliminary Injunction

add_extracted.value: Indefinite: The preliminary injunction remains in effect until further order by the court

evidence.text: To address a growing encampment of unhoused individuals and related health and safety concerns, Defendant City of San Rafael enacted an ordinance (“Chapter 19.50”) that limited campsite sizes and their locations. Plaintiffs brought suit alleging the ordinance violated various statutory and constitutional rights.
evidence.source_document: Order Granting Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

evidence.text: As of July 2024, there are 67. See Docket No. 187-1 at ¶ 5 (Hess Decl.)
evidence.source_document: Order Granting Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

add_extracted.value: The Plaintiffs, including Camp Integrity (a community of campers) and the San Rafael Homeless Union, alleged that the City of San Rafael's ordinance (SMC 19.50) violated their constitutional and statutory rights by restricting camping on public property without adequate accommodations, leading to an encampment of 67 tents at Mahon Creek Path as of July 2024.

evidence.text: On August 11, 2023, Camp Integrity and ten individual plaintiffs filed their complaint and moved for a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction.
evidence.source_document: Order Granting Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed Verified Complaint on August 11, 2023, seeking a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction against San Rafael Code 19.50

evidence.text: Four days later, Judge Thompson granted Plaintiffs’ request for a temporary restraining order halting enforcement of the ordinance.
evidence.source_document: Order Granting Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

add_extracted.value: Court granted Temporary Restraining Order on August 16, 2023, halting enforcement of the ordinance

evidence.text: On October 19, 2023, the Court granted in part and denied in part Plaintiffs’ motion for a preliminary injunction.
evidence.source_document: Order Granting Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

add_extracted.value: Court granted Preliminary Injunction on October 19, 2023, with conditions including 400 square foot campsites and 100-foot buffer

evidence.text: This Order clarifies aspects of this Court’s preliminary injunction issued on October 19, 2023 (Docket No. 98).
evidence.source_document: Order Clarifying Scope of Preliminary Injunction

add_extracted.value: Court issued Order Clarifying Scope of Preliminary Injunction on November 2, 2023, narrowing protections to Mahon Creek Path residents

evidence.text: On May 10, 2024, Defendant filed a notice for a motion to dismiss or in the alternative to dissolve the preliminary injunction.
evidence.source_document: Order Granting Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

add_extracted.value: Defendant filed Motion to Dismiss on May 10, 2024, which was granted on August 7, 2024, rendering case moot
